message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a deep reinforcement learning approach to accelerate the convergence rate of deep neural networks. This involves learning policies for scheduling learning rates during optimization, with the goal of minimizing training time while achieving a certain performance goal. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also experiments on a standard benchmark dataset in computer vision (MNIST), suggesting cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) as another likely sub-category. Finally, the use of reinforcement learning to optimize a DNN can also be seen as a control problem, which falls under cs.SY (Systems and Control).
